title: Lag when Near Enemy Players
body: I get EXTREME lag when I am near enemy players. It's most noticeable in ARAM, where everyone is packed together and non-existent in bots where there are no enemy players. If I'm say, at my base, or in I can play perfectly fine without any lag. I can be by whole my team and 3 waves of super minions crashing on our nexus with no issue. The moment an enemy player appears near me, I lag like crazy. Pretty frustrating :|

replies.body: Can you specify which type of "lag" you're seeing? Are you seeing changes in your FPS or are you seeing changes in your latency (ping) when this happens?

I could also say that I highly doubt it's actually linked to the appearance of enemy players, it's more likely I just tend to notice it more during crucial moments. That being said, it occurred for the first time in a bots game, my ping went up to 1k and fps dropped to about 60-70 from 90-100. 

I ran a tracert and got this:


Tracing route to 192.64.170.40 over a maximum of 30 hops

  1     1 ms     1 ms     1 ms  192.168.0.1 
  2    12 ms    10 ms    11 ms  10.138.117.1 
  3    32 ms    30 ms    31 ms  172.30.93.145 
  4    33 ms    32 ms    32 ms  68-66-72-153.client.mchsi.com [68.66.72.153] 
  5    31 ms    30 ms    31 ms  ae11.mpr3.phx2.us.above.net [64.125.173.73] 
  6    39 ms    40 ms    38 ms  ae28.cs1.lax112.us.eth.zayo.com [64.125.31.252] 
  7    44 ms    47 ms    39 ms  ae0.cs2.lax112.us.eth.zayo.com [64.125.28.233] 
  8    40 ms    39 ms    40 ms  ae27.cr2.lax112.us.zip.zayo.com [64.125.30.187] 
  9    41 ms    43 ms    40 ms  ae16.er2.lax112.us.zip.zayo.com [64.125.25.158] 
 10    41 ms    38 ms    39 ms  64.125.170.174.IPYX-089814-750.zip.zayo.com [64.125.170.174] 
 11    41 ms    40 ms    40 ms  104.160.133.35 
 12    85 ms    85 ms    86 ms  ae36-br01.chi01.riotdirect.net [104.160.159.66] 
 13    85 ms    84 ms    85 ms  104.160.131.34 
 14    85 ms    87 ms    83 ms  104.160.131.46 
 15    89 ms    83 ms    86 ms  104.160.131.101 
 16    87 ms    93 ms   102 ms  10.23.246.14 
 17     *        *        *     Request timed out.
 18     *        *        *     Request timed out.
 19     *        *        *     Request timed out.
 20     *        *        *     Request timed out.
 21     *        *        *     Request timed out.
 22     *        *        *     Request timed out.
 23     *        *        *     Request timed out.
 24     *        *        *     Request timed out.
 25     *        *        *     Request timed out.
 26     *        *        *     Request timed out.
 27     *        *        *     Request timed out.
 28     *        *        *     Request timed out.
 29     *        *        *     Request timed out.
 30     *        *        *     Request timed out.

Trace complete.


It's clear to me that there is an issue, as running it a second time acheived basically the same results, although with higher latency during each hop.

It definitely looks like there may be some routing issues. I'd like you to run a full traceroute using a program called [**WinMTR**](http://winmtr.net/). Simply boot up the app, paste **104.160.131.1** into the host field, then start the trace. After the trace has run for 5 minutes, export the results as text and paste them in a reply to me.

Let me know if you run into any issues with this.

There are definitely some indications of high latency on most of the Zayo nodes your connection travels across. I suspect that during your matches, you'd see considerable changes in your route and there may be more packet loss or latency spikes during gameplay than when we simply run tests. Just to confirm there's nothing local exacerbating this issue, I'd recommend confirming all your network settings are aligned with our [network guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues).

Should you continue to experience these issues even *after* confirming your local settings are good, I'd recommend running another WinMTR traceroute while you play a match (with symptoms) and reach out to your ISP with that traceroute.

Let me know if you have any questions.

My issue with that is... it might happen for 2-3 minutes, be perfectly for the next ten, hapen for another 2-3 minute etc etc But I will attempt to do as you reccommend and I thank you for your help.

EDIT:

I ran the test and the red and yellow indicated this:



    We received unexpected and possibly dangerous results when looking up important names
    Your DNS resolver returns IP addresses for names that do not exist 

Minor Aberrations
â€“

    Certain TCP protocols are blocked in outbound traffic
    Some DNS resolvers appear to be down
    Only some root servers returned DNSSEC information 



I will contact my ISP, but any advice on to what actually tell them? I'm not THAT technologically savvy, and I know they will try to just bullshit me the answers and charge me to come out while solving nothing(as they did the last time they came out). If I can come to them with some knowledge of the problem, I can at least press the issue that at least until it is resolved they wont get anything from me. Thanks in advance, you've been very helpful. 

EDIT2:

Upon further inspection, it denotes that  major problem is my ISP rerouting bad requests to advertisements, which they most definitely do, but I don't see how that would necesarilly affect my connection to league. Either way, I will attempt to resolve these issues but any guidance you can provide on exactly what to discuss with my ISP would be much appreciated.

I'd reach out with what you've experiencing, then provide them the traceroute you ran above and the Netalyzr link that you pulled this information from. All of that should provide enough context for them to launch an investigation and resolve this.

Let me know if you have any other questions.
I'll try, thanks! Might just be time to switch ISPs because the last 3 times they've come out here for any issue at all they blame it on a splitter.

Its mostly a latency issue, but it does call small fps drop of about ten. My internet isn't the best, so I'm sure an issue is there, but I used to NEVER have issues of this nature before. It isn't always happening, either, however.
